Articles.Content:
Post your memorials of previous flights. Include name, name of ship+type(lander, satellite) and how they died. If you can\'t remember the names, just use Jeb, Bill, and Bob. True stories only!

RIP Jebediah, Bill, and Bob Kerman (Luna I: Lander)

Their lander malfunctioned upon takeoff on the Mun, and were left stranded.

RIP Melnie, Jim and Sheplong (Lander V1, Lander)

They landed, but didn\'t have enough fuel left for return.

Shelgar Kerman, Alsey Kerman, and Dunton Kerman

These brave Kerbals sacrificed their lives to cover up the utter failure of the Kerbal Space Center\'s computer and autopilot development program, as a result of which all \'unmanned\' probes launched by the Kerbal Space Program have to be piloted manually. Their Munprobe spacecraft successfully performed its mission and landed in the center of one of the munar mares; its design, however, did not include a return stage.

RIP

RIP Munlander Probe pro I Jeb, Bill and bob died in that collision.

They didn\'t have enough fuel to power land on the mun, they ended up crashing to a mountain.

RIP Bill, Bob, and Jeb

Jeb saw his reflection in the mirror and was stunned, sending the B-7 into the tracking station on a low pass
RIP bill, bob, and jeb, for there ultra low orbit over the mun, that just didnt clear that mountain...
